intro: Senecio robustus, commonly known as the stiffstem senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its robust, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Senecio robustus is also noted for its ability to tolerate drought conditions once established.
